data.title: Beautiful Venue
data.text: Attended the Post Modern Jukebox Concert and had a great time. The building is beautiful with great acoustics. The lowere level seting was comfortable, but the upper level is very cramped for leg space. Check in for the concert was smooth and staff were friendly and helpful with finding seats. Parking is a block away. Enjoyed this event.

data.title: An intimate venue
data.text:
The renovation was done well; not as opulent as the Fabulous Fox Theater, this is nevertheless a St Louis jewel. Can't believe there's a bad seat in the house.

You do enter below the auditorium level - there must be elevators for those who need them, but we hiked up to the ground floor to get to our seats. 

Security was evident; we were wanded going in the door.

data.title: Worth it just to see building
data.text: I didn't know what to expect from an Opera House in St. Louis, but I was sure impressed.   An impeccable building with gorgeous details.   I would happily sit through a terrible show just to experience the building again!

data.title: Good Concert Venue
data.text: Saw the rock group Chicago perform. The facility has the old style theater feel, cool architecture. Our seats were the next to the last row. Overall good, yet a little tight. Sometimes it was a little hard to understand the vocals unless you actually knew the song.

data.title: Nice venue
data.text: The building is old... So it looks and feels old when you walk up to it. It feels a little cold with all the gray marble and black iron inside. The inside seating area is very nice. Not as nice as Fox. Seating is impossible in the upper deck. Feel a thousand miles away and you can't sit with the lack of leg room.  You just have to appreciate the place was built 100 years ago and was fabulously restored. Don't waste your money unless you sit in lower level.

data.title: Beautiful theater - poor planning
data.text: Friends and I attended the Willie Nelson concert at the Peabody Saturday night.  There were 3 acts, and when we went out between the 2nd/3rd, we found they'd run out of beer.  I don't mean they ran out of my preferred brand, I mean they were OUT OF BEER.  All the staff could tell us was to try another bar on another level. A lot of unhappy concert-goers and I'm sure a lot of potential profit lost.  The theater itself is very nice and we didn't have any issues with legroom that others have mentioned.  It just felt like they are more used to a wine-sipping sort of audience.

data.title: Great view of the stage
data.text: Enjoyed Kirk Franklin in packed house.  Orchestra level seats on the left were roomy and the view of the stage was great.  I do not share the "no legroom" experience with many other reviewers, but it appears that problem is common in the mezzanine. The sound was super, the performance went almost 3 hours, but we had a great time.  Beautiful building and didn't have a problem with parking or getting in or out of venue.  Will look for more opportunities to visit.

data.title: Beautiful venue spoiled by the staff
data.text:
We attended a wonderful wedding and the reception was at this magnificent building. 
A more lovely venue could not have been chosen. 
If only the ushers were trained in customer relations instead of strong arm tactics. 
They were devoid of personality and wee gruff with the guests. 
Fortunately the happy occasion overshadowed these incompetent people.

data.title: Very pretty!
data.text: We recently saw a concert at the Peabody (Bonnie Raitt), and had a great time. More seating in club area would be good, we were standing quite a while before doors opened for the actual concert. We would go again.

data.title: Seating is Unacceptable for Concert Venue
data.text: Although the building's architecture and interior design are beautiful (2 stars for that), the seating in the balcony is extremely tight.  If you suffer from claustrophobia, do not purchase tickets in the balcony.  Having learned my lesson, I purchased tickets in Row N - ORCHLT to avoid the crammed seats; however, even though the seating chart showed an aisle between my seats and the seats in front of me, regular chairs had been positioned in front of me, which were about 6 inches higher than the original theatre seats. As my luck would have it, a man over 6 feet tall sat in the seat in front of me and obstructed 1/3 of my view.  VERY frustrating and disappointing.  Do NOT buy in Row N or in the balcony.

data.title: Musical to see Janis Joplin musical
data.text: What a beautiful and historic building. It's stunning: elegant, and well laid out. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable about how to meet you needs. The play I saw there was amazing too, and of course the acoustics were a part of the success as it was a musical.  Very conveniently located on Market street in an historic section of downtown.

data.title: Nice Venue!
data.text: Went to the Peabody to see Jason Isbell - we had seats in the Mezzanine- view was great sound was great - and most of all - Jason Isbell was marvelous!  The seats in the mezzanine were quite tight- and relatively uncomfortable- but the concert made up for it!

data.title: Nice Venue
data.text: My wife & I were here for a comedy act and had floor seats for the performance. The view was great even though it felt a little cramped. I wouldn't want to sit there for much longer than we did (around 2-2.5 hrs with a break about halfway through) but the seats were comfy enough and the location was reasonable for getting to & from.

data.title: NEVER, EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!
data.text:
NEVER, EVER AGAIN will I sit in the mezzanine....if I return at all. Unless you are very short, there is absolutely NO leg room.  No matter how wonderful the performance might be, the torturous seating will negate any positive feelings patrons might have.  

Spend the extra money for orchestra seating or be prepared to suffer through the uncomfortable seating our group experienced. 

 The refurbished venue is beautiful.

data.title: Shen Yun
data.text:
We saw an afternoon performance of Shen Yun. The tickets were, I thought, reasonably priced for the show. The seats were very good for what I paid, especially as I purchased them somewhat late in the game. 

Barring one lady, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Concessions seemed expensive: $5 for small bag of popcorn and $7.50 for a large soft drink. Still, the Opera House has to make money and concessions are high at theaters, too.

Beautiful theatre and pleasant environment.

data.title: We saw Elf.
data.text: As a family we sent to Elf at the Peabody yesterday.  It was the afternoon performance.  It was pouring down rain so traffic was crazy as were the parking lots.  The Peabody is beautiful and has a nice size staircase on both sides to go upstairs. We were in Mezzanine seats but the view was great as was the sound.  I would sit up there again.  Getting out of the parking lot after the show was the problem, it took a half an hour.  No help from anyone directing traffic and the Blues fans were coming in for a game when we were trying to get out.

data.title: Not a bad seat in the house!
data.text: Loved the Peabody Opera House. Visited for a concert on Dec 16th. The opera house was sold out. My seats were up on the second level. Got there early enough to look at views of the stage from other areas. Could not find a bad seat. Very nice, very clean. Ushers were exceptionally nice as well. Only complaint, no leg room. Your knees will hit the seat in front of you and if you're tall, you will have to sit sideways, other than that, it's a great place! Will definitely return.

data.title: Really nice
data.text: We enjoyed a concert at the Peabody. The acoustics were great, the visibility of the stage was great. The Opera House is beautiful. I look forward to going again in the future.

data.title: Like the Fox Theater
data.text:
Reminds me very much of the Fox Theater on grand so if you like that you'll like the Peabody. Not quite as grand but still in good shape after all the years as Kiel Opera House. I hadn't been since it reopened but did enjoy myself there. Sat a few rows from the back and view was fine for the much cheaper price I paid.

Only negatives were the lack of leg room in mezzanine seats and I'm only 5'8 and my legs were up against seats in front of me. And drink prices were like a Cards game at $8.25 for aluminum bottle. 

Nice that they have elevators for people who can't walk the steps. Wasn't me but it is a hike to the top and all bathrooms seemed to involve steps. 

Hopefully they'll have more concerts in the future that I like. Saw the sold out REO Speedwagon concert for KSHE's 48th bday.

data.title: Excellent Service
data.text: Went to O Reilly/Miller Tour. Had dinner there was fabulous. Service was outstanding. Very Elegant and clean. The seats were very cramped no front leg room at all not even a little bit in mezzanine level. Row had to stand up to move out for people. Literally had to step out into isle. However ii is an amazing place to have fine dining and great entertainment.
